intro: Aniselytron, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has oval, hairy leaves. Aniselytron is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
